1063.question: What is the performance change of the textual semantic similarity task when no error and maximum errors (noise) are present?

5-Figure5-1.png: The performance change of the textual semantic similarity task when no error and maximum errors (noise) are present is shown in the figure. The results indicate that the performance of the task is negatively affected by the presence of noise, with a decrease in the correlation coefficient.

1063.answer:
10 Epochs: pearson-Spearman correlation  drops  60 points when error increase by 20%
50 Epochs: pearson-Spearman correlation  drops  55 points when error increase by 20%

1064.question: Which sentiment analysis data set has a larger performance drop when a 10% error is introduced?

4-Figure4-1.png: The sentiment analysis data set that has a larger performance drop when a 10% error is introduced is Sentiment analysis on SST-2 data.
